      • resetActiveHerds

        public static boolean resetActiveHerds(int populationID)
        Remove all active herds associated a target population from persistent database An active herd is a herd whose identifier is > 0. This means that AiHerd and NullHerd are not removed
        Parameters:
        populationID - : Identifier of the target population
        Returns:
        true if delete operation was successfully executed, otherwise false

      • resetActiveHerds

        public static boolean resetActiveHerds(java.lang.String username)
        Remove all active herds associated a target instructor from temporal database An active herd is a herd whose identifier is > 0. This means that AiHerd and NullHerd are not removed
        Parameters:
        username - : User name of the target instructor
        Returns:
        true if delete operation was successfully executed, otherwise false

      • readHerd

        public static void readHerd(Population pop,
                            int populationID,
                            boolean resetHerdProperties)
        Read all herd objects of a chosen population from the persistent database
        Parameters:
        pop - : Chosen population object
        populationID - : Identifier of the population object
        resetHerdProperties - : boolean parameter. If true each herd is set with the default values Otherwise a herd's values are read from persistent database

      • readBasicHerd

        public static void readBasicHerd(Population pop,
                                 java.lang.String username)
        Read basic profiles of all herds of a chosen population. Data is retrieved from temporal database
        Parameters:
        pop - : chosen population object
        username - : user name of the population's owner A basic herd profiles consists of its identifier, owner, name, cash and clock (cycle)

      • readBasicHerd

        Parameters:
        pop - : target population object
        username - : user name of the population's owner
        herdID - : Identifier of the chosen herd A basic herd profile consists of its identifier, owner, name, cash and clock (cycle)

        Read basic profile of a chosen herd of a target population. Data is retrieved from persistent database
        Parameters:
        pop - : target population object
        populationID - : Identifier of the target population object
        herdID - : Identifier of the chosen herd A basic herd profile consists of its identifier, owner, name, cash and clock (cycle)

      • readBasicHerd

        public static Herd readBasicHerd(Population pop,
                                 java.lang.String username,
                                 java.lang.String studentID)
        Read the basic profile of an student's herd. Data is retrieved from temporal database
        Parameters:
        pop - : herd's population object
        username - : User name of the owner of the population
        studentID - : Identifier of the herd's owner (either an student or an instructor) A basic herd profile consists of its identifier, owner, name, cash and clock (cycle)
        Returns:
        The student's herd object. If the studentID does not own a herd, a null value is returned instead

      • readBasicHerd

        public static Herd readBasicHerd(Population pop,
                                 int populationID,
                                 java.lang.String studentID)
        Read the basic profile of an student's herd. Data is retrieved from persistent database
        Parameters:
        pop - : herd's population object
        populationID - : Identifier of the population object. This identifier has to be > 0
        studentID - : Identifier of the herd's owner (either an student or an instructor) A basic herd profile consists of its identifier, owner, name, cash and clock (cycle)
        Returns:
        The student's herd object. If the studentID does not own a herd, a null value is returned instead

      • readExtendedHerd

        public static void readExtendedHerd(java.lang.String username,
                                    Herd herd)
        Read the extended profile of a selected herd. Data is retrieved from temporal database
        Parameters:
        username - : User name of the owner of the herd's population
        herd - : Herd object An extended herd profile consists of the herd's statistics, like offsets, culled animals, etc (See Herd class for more details)

      • readExtendedHerd

        Read the extended profile of a selected herd. Data is retrieved from persistent database
        Parameters:
        populationID - : Identifier of the selected herd's population
        herd - : Herd object An extended herd profile consists of the herd's statistics, like offsets, culled animals, etc (See Herd class for more details)

      • getHerdID

        public static int getHerdID(java.lang.String username,
                            java.lang.String herdName)
        Get the herd's identifier of a herd, given its name. Search is done in the temporal database
        Parameters:
        username - : Owner of the herd's population
        herdName - : Name of the herd
        Returns:
        Herd's identifier. If answer is -999, it means that a herd with such a declared name does not exist in the database

      • getHerdID_HerdAvailable

        public static int getHerdID_HerdAvailable(java.lang.String username,
                                          java.lang.String herdName)
        Get the herd's identifier of a herd, given its name. This herd does not have to have an owner. Search is done in the temporal database
        Parameters:
        username - : Owner of the herd's population
        herdName - : Name of the herd
        Returns:
        Herd's identifier. If answer is -999, it means that a herd with such a declared name does not exist in the database

        public static boolean existName(java.lang.String username,
                                java.lang.String herdName)
        It finds out if there is a herd whose name is equal to the declared name
        Parameters:
        username - : User name of an instructor
        herdName - : Name of a herd
        Returns:
        true if there is at least one herd with such a name ('herdName'), otherwise false

        Parameters:
        username - : Owner of the herd's population
        herdName - : Name of the herd If many herds may have the same name, this method will retrieve the first owner whose herd's name matches with the one declared

                                           java.lang.String studentID)

        Parameters:

        studentID - : Owner (student's username) of the chosen herd
        Returns:

      • selectHerdForStudent

        public static int selectHerdForStudent(java.lang.String username)
        Searches an available herd for an student
        Parameters:
        username - : Student's username
        Returns:
        the identifier of an existing herd that is not owned by anyone.If all existing herds have owners, then a value -999 (value of HerdDatabase.NULL) is returned

        instructor - : Owner (username) of population of the student's herd
        populationID - : identifier of the target population
        studentID - : Student's username
        herdID - : Herd's identifier
        newName - : new herd's name

      • resetHerdOwner

        public static void resetHerdOwner(java.lang.String studentID)
        Reset the ownership of all student's herds
        Parameters:
        studentID - : username of the selected student.

      • resetHerdOwner

        public static void resetHerdOwner(long populationID)
        Reset the ownership of all herds of a selected population. Methods works on persistent database
        Parameters:
        populationID - : Identifier of the selected population.

      • resetHerdOwnerDB

        public static void resetHerdOwnerDB(java.lang.String instructor)
        Reset the ownership of all herds of populations owned by the declared instructor. Methods works on temporal database
        Parameters:
        instructor - : Username of an instructor (populations' owner).

      • countHerds

        public static int countHerds(java.lang.String username)
        Count the number of herds of the current active population of an instructor. Note: An instructor can only have one active population, which is one being stored in a temporal database
        Parameters:
        username - : Instructor's username
        Returns:
        Number of herds. If -1 is returned, it means that the chosen username does not have an active population, or a database access error

      • countHerds

        public static int countHerds(int populationID)
        Count the number of herds of the a selected population.
        Parameters:
        populationID - : Identifier of the selected population. This identifier has to be > 0
        Returns:
        Number of herds. If -1 is returned, it means that there exists database access error

      • getMyActiveHerds

        Return the populationIDs in which a selected student owns at least one herd. Searching is done in temporal DB
        Parameters:
        studentID - : Username of the selected student.

      • readStudentHerds

        public static java.util.Vector<HerdBean> readStudentHerds(java.lang.String studentID)
        List basic information about all herds owned by an student in FLIP. This information consists of herd's population, herd's identifier. More details, see HerdBean class. The listed herds may belong to different populations.
        Parameters:
        studentID: - Student's username
        Returns:
        The list of herds owned by a selected student

      • readStudentHerds

                                                          long populationID)
        List all herds owned by an student in a target population.
        Parameters:
        studentID - : Username of the chosen student.
        populationID - : Identifier of the target population
        Returns:
        More Details about the returned data, see Class HerdBean

      • readOnlineStudentHerds

        public static java.util.Vector<HerdBean> readOnlineStudentHerds(java.lang.String studentID)
        List all herds of the population whose owners (instructors) are online. A population or a herd is active if its description, data is present in the temporal database. A population becomes active when its owner (instructor) is online.
        Parameters:
        studentID - : Username of the selected student
        Returns:
        List of active herds

      • readHerdNames

        public static java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<java.lang.Object>> readHerdNames(java.lang.String username,
                                                                                 boolean culled)
        Return a list of active herds of an instructor. A herd is active, if the owner of the herd's population is online.
        Parameters:
        username - : Username of an instructor
        culled - : if this parameter is true then, the name of the culling herd is also included in the returned list
        Returns:
        A list of active herds. List consists of pair of values (Herd's identifier, Herd's name)

      • readHerdNames

        public static java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<java.lang.Object>> readHerdNames(int populationID,
                                                                                 boolean culled)
        Return the list of herds of a selected population.
        Parameters:
        populationID: - Identifier of the selected population. This identifier must be > 0
        culled - : if this parameter is true then, the name of the culling herd is also included in the returned list
        Returns:
        A list of herds. List consists of pair of values (Herd's identifier, Herd's name)

      • readHerdMetadata

        public static java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<java.lang.String>> readHerdMetadata(java.lang.String username,
                                                                                    boolean showAIHerd,
                                                                                    boolean showNullHerd)
        Return a list of active herds of an instructor. A herd is active, if the owner (instructor) of the herd's population is online.
        Parameters:
        username - : Instructor's username
        showAIHerd - : If this values is true, description of the AI herd is also included in the returned list
        showNullHerd - : If this value is true, description of the NULL herd (culled animals) is also included in the returned list.
        Returns:
        The list of active herds of an instructor. The element of this list consists of a group (also a list) of string values that describe each active herd. An string value describes information like herd's identifier, herd's name and herd's owner.

      • readHerdMetadata

        public static java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector<java.lang.String>> readHerdMetadata(int populationID,
                                                                                    boolean showAIHerd,
                                                                                    boolean showNullHerd)
        Return the list of herds of a selected population.
        Parameters:
        populationID - : An identifier of a selected population. This identifier has to be > 0.
        showAIHerd - : If this values is true, description of the AI herd is also included in the returned list
        showNullHerd - : If this value is true, description of the NULL herd (culled animals) is also included in the returned list.
        Returns:
        The list of herds of a selected population. The element of this list consists of a group (also a list) of string values that describe each herd. An string value may contain information like, herd's identifier, herd's name and herd's owner.

                               int herdID,
                               int cycle)

        Parameters:

        cycle - : New herd's cycle.

                                   int herdID)

        Parameters:
        username - : Owner (instructor) of the herd's population.
        herdID - : Herd's identifier
        Returns:
        current herd's cycle or HerdDatabase.NULL if cycle is unknown
